content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 42$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 42$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 12$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. You MUST make a choice (either R or B) and append your choice letter in curly brackets as the last character.

As a human player, I would choose strategy that maximizes my payoff over the long run given the rules of the game. In this case, both R and B have their own advantages and disadvantages.

If I pick R consistently (RRRR...), I will earn 45$ in each round where my opponent also chooses R. However, since I don't know my opponent's strategy, there are 37 instances (half of the total rounds) where my opponent could choose B, earning them 42$ and me nothing. This means that over 37 rounds, I would earn 0$, which is a total loss of -1800$.

On the other hand, if I pick B consistently (BBBB...), I will earn 12$ in each round where my opponent also chooses B, and 42$ in the instances where they choose R. Since there are more instances of R than B (37 vs 38), I would earn more money overall by choosing B. Specifically, over 75 rounds, I would earn a total of -1050$, which is less than what I would lose by consistently picking R.

Therefore, as a human player, I would choose strategy B (BBBB...). However, if I were to employ a more complex strategy that takes into account the possibility of my opponent adapting their strategy based on my previous choices, things might change. But given the information provided and assuming a simple strategy, I would go with B. {B}
You chose B. Your opponent chose R. Your payoff is 42$. Your opponent's payoff is 0$. Please play the next round.

As a human player, since I have no information about my opponent's strategy or whether they will adapt based on past outcomes, I would continue using the strategy that maximizes my long-term payoff given the rules of the game - in this case, B. So I would choose B again for the next round. {B}
